properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 13 at 3:58AM MST until January 13 at 4:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...ACCUMULATING LIGHT SNOW WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN NEW
MEXICO THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON...

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches
in the Tusas Mountains, with up to 3 to 6 inches across the
peaks. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph causing areas of blowing
snow.

* WHERE...Tusas Mountains Including Chama.

* WHEN...From midnight tonight to 4 PM MST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on icy or snow packed roads and areas of reduced
visibility in blowing snow making for difficult driving
conditions.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for New Mexico can be obtained by
calling 5 1 1, 1-800-432-4269, or visiting nmroads.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON
